Header: Development projects in the Polonnaruwa district vested with the public by the President
Content: Several development projects implemented under the Pibidemu Polonnaruwa district development programme were vested with the public under the patronage of President Maithripala Sirisena. The President vested with the public the Kaduruwela water pumping station and tank of the Polonnaruwa water supply project with the aim of providing clean drinking water to the people in the area. 2,240 million rupees has been spent on the project. It will provide drinking water to Polonnaruwa new town, old town, Kaduruwela and to its surrounding areas. Sevanapitiya Aqua Culture Development Centre built at a cost of 430 million rupees under the Pibidemu Polonnaruwa programme was vested with the people by the President. The Rathmal-kandiya health clinic built with the aim of improving health facilities of the public was vested with the people under the patronage of President Maithripala Sirisena. The President also vested with the people Mudun-kadawala health clinic constructed at a cost of 11 million rupees. A building of the Nikawatha-landa Sri Poorwarama Temple renovated at a cost of 2.5 million rupees was offered to the Sangha by the President. He also vested the new Dhamma school building of Sri Vishuddarama Temple at Aralaganwila, Yaaya Paha with the students.
